contents.text:
Student email: student@example.com
Study plan:
{"rationale":"Milestones are mapped directly to the AI-102 skills measured domains (Plan/Manage; Generative AI; Agentic; Vision; NLP incl. Speech; Knowledge mining & information extraction). With 6 hours/week for 8 weeks (~48 hours), the plan uses four ~90-minute sessions weekly (balanced workload), sequences prerequisites first (planning, SDKs, responsible AI) before hands-on builds (RAG, agents, Vision/NLP, Search/Document Intelligence), and includes spaced reinforcement: weekly mini-reviews plus two practice-assessment checkpoints (midpoint + final) to identify gaps before the final consolidation week.","planTitle":"Azure AI Engineer Associate (AI-102) — 8-Week / 6 Hours-Per-Week Study Plan","durationWeeks":8,"weeklyHours":6,"weeklyMilestones":[{"weekNumber":1,"objective":"Orient to AI-102, set up your environment, and cover planning/responsible AI foundations (Foundry/Azure AI resource selection, SDKs, keys/auth basics).","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Read the certification + exam pages to understand scope and expectations: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/azure-ai-engineer/ and https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/","Skim the AI-102 study guide skills measured and create a checklist you’ll track weekly: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","Decide your primary language (Python or C#) and note the SDKs you’ll use."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["From the AI-102 course shell, note the major topic areas you’ll implement over the next 8 weeks: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/courses/ai-102t00","Complete the planning module (focus: Azure AI services vs Foundry, tools/SDKs, responsible AI): https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/prepare-azure-ai-development/","Do the module knowledge check and capture weak points."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Plan/Manage focus: using the study guide, write a 1-page ‘service selection map’ (which service for: generative AI, vision, language, speech, search, document extraction).","Set up a minimal dev workspace (repo, virtualenv/.NET solution, config handling for endpoints/keys).","Draft a reusable request helper (REST or SDK) pattern you’ll reuse across services (auth header, retries, logging)."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Responsible AI focus (from study guide topics): list controls you must remember for the exam (content moderation/safety, filters/blocklists, prompt shields/harm detection, governance).","Create a personal ‘Exam Notes’ document with: endpoints vs keys vs Entra ID auth, monitoring/cost concepts, and container deployment as a concept item.","Weekly review: 15-minute self-quiz against your checklist; mark items as Green/Yellow/Red."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) AI-102 skills checklist with status, (2) environment ready (repo + config pattern), (3) 1-page service selection map + responsible AI notes."},{"weekNumber":2,"objective":"Implement core generative AI patterns: model deployment basics, prompt engineering habits, and introduce RAG conceptually.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Use the study guide’s Generative AI section to outline what you must be able to do (deploy model, prompt flow, RAG, evaluation, monitoring).","In Foundry (or conceptually if access-limited), note steps: hub/project/resources, model selection/deployment options.","Write 10 prompt-engineering ‘before/after’ examples (system instructions, few-shot, constraints, grounding placeholders)."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Work through a RAG overview module (grounding with your data, indexing with Azure AI Search): https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/","Focus on: why grounding, how data is indexed, and where citations come from.","Summarize the RAG pipeline in a diagram (ingest → chunk → embed → index → retrieve → prompt → generate)."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Hands-on (lightweight): implement a minimal ‘chat’ caller using your chosen SDK/REST (prompt + parameters like temperature/max tokens).","Experiment with parameter changes and record outcomes (determinism vs creativity).","Add basic logging/tracing placeholders (request id, latency) to align with monitoring objectives."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["RAG reinforcement: define chunking strategy and retrieval settings you’d tune (topK, filters, semantic vs vector, citations).","Create 15 flashcards: model types, embeddings usage, vector store concept, and responsible prompting safeguards.","Weekly review: update checklist; identify 3 items to revisit next week."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) RAG pipeline diagram, (2) minimal prompt caller code skeleton, (3) prompt/parameter experiment notes + flashcards."},{"weekNumber":3,"objective":"Build RAG with Azure AI Search concepts and connect it to generative workflows (indexes, queries, vector/semantic basics).","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Study the AI-102 knowledge mining objectives: provisioning Search, index/data source/indexer, querying, semantic + vector store solutions.","Read the Azure AI Search training landing page to choose a path for deeper study (note the ‘Implement knowledge mining’ path reference): https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training","Write down: index schema essentials (fields, key, searchable/filterable/facetable/sortable)."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["RAG integration recap: revisit the RAG module sections on making data searchable and implementing RAG in a flow: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/","Define your ‘toy dataset’ (5–10 docs) and how you would ingest it (blob/files).","Create a step checklist for: create index → load docs → (optional) embeddings → query → pass results into prompt context."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Search querying practice (conceptual or actual): draft example queries demonstrating filtering, sorting, wildcards, semantic vs vector intent.","Note the key verification behavior for grounded answers and citations (what ‘good’ grounding looks like).","If exploring agents later, note tool constraints for AI Search with agents (single index, tenant constraints): https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-foundry/agents/how-to/tools/ai-search?view=foundry#limitations"]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Weekly synthesis: write a 1-page ‘Azure AI Search for RAG’ summary: components + common pitfalls.","Create 10 practice Q&A items for yourself (e.g., when to use indexers vs push API, how skillsets enrich content).","Checklist update + plan next week’s agent focus."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) 1-page Search-for-RAG summary, (2) example query set, (3) step-by-step build checklist for a basic RAG solution."},{"weekNumber":4,"objective":"Implement an agentic solution: understand agents, build a basic agent, and know testing/optimization/deployment considerations.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Study the AI-102 agentic objectives (role/use cases, resources, create agent, complex workflows, test/optimize/deploy).","Complete the agent module overview units: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/","Write down when you’d choose an agent vs a single prompt/chain."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Do the agent module exercise (or simulate it with notes if you lack access) and capture: tool use, instructions, and response validation steps: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/","Document an ‘agent contract’: inputs, tools available, tool-output formatting, and safety constraints.","Add evaluation criteria (task success, hallucination rate, grounded citations, latency)."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Connect agent + retrieval conceptually: outline how the agent calls AI Search (what it sends, what it receives, how it cites).","Write 3 multi-step workflows (e.g., summarize doc set → extract action items → generate email) and specify tool calls.","Add a small ‘testing matrix’ (happy path, missing data, ambiguous question, unsafe prompt)."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Midpoint practice assessment (timed, but stop to learn): take the official practice assessment and record weak areas: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/practice/assessment?assessment-type=practice&assessmentId=61","Review results and tag your checklist items Red/Yellow.","Create a remediation list for Weeks 5–7 (top 5 gaps)."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) basic agent notes/exercise completion, (2) 3 workflow designs + testing matrix, (3) practice assessment gap list with remediation targets."},{"weekNumber":5,"objective":"Implement computer vision solutions (image analysis, OCR, custom vision concepts, video insights).","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Study the Vision objectives from the AI-102 study guide: visual features, object detection/tags, responses, OCR/handwriting, video indexer, spatial analysis.","Create a ‘request/response’ template: what you send (features/options) and how to interpret results.","Do a mini-drill: pick 5 sample images and predict what features you’d request for each scenario."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["OCR focus: outline steps for extracting printed vs handwritten text; record common output fields and error handling.","Custom vision focus: decide classification vs object detection for 3 scenarios; write what labeling looks like and which metrics matter.","Add flashcards: metrics (precision/recall), publish/consume, and code-first model usage."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Video analysis: summarize what Azure AI Video Indexer provides (insights extraction from video/live stream).","Spatial analysis concept: presence/movement detection and typical privacy considerations.","Write 5 exam-style scenarios mapping requirement → service/feature choice."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Weekly review: consolidate vision notes into a 2-page ‘Vision cheat sheet’ (features, OCR, custom model lifecycle, video).","Revisit any Red/Yellow items from the practice assessment that relate to vision.","Checklist update."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) Vision cheat sheet, (2) 5 scenario-to-service mappings, (3) flashcards for custom vision lifecycle + OCR."},{"weekNumber":6,"objective":"Implement NLP solutions: text analytics + translation; plus speech fundamentals and customization concepts.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Study NLP objectives: key phrases/entities, sentiment, language detection, PII, translation; plus speech-to-text, text-to-speech, SSML, custom speech, intent/keyword recognition.","Create a ‘text analytics decision tree’ mapping a requirement to the analysis operation.","Draft 10 short text samples and decide which NLP operation you’d run and why."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Translation focus: outline translating text vs documents; note when you’d translate before downstream steps (e.g., PII then translate vs translate then PII).","PII handling: write a secure-handling checklist (masking, storage, logging rules).","Create 5 exam-style scenario prompts mapping requirement → service/feature."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Speech focus: write a pipeline for speech-to-text and text-to-speech; include SSML enhancements (prosody, pronunciation).","Custom speech concept: when to customize and what evaluate/deploy looks like.","Add responsible AI/privacy notes for speech (consent, retention)."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Weekly synthesis: 1–2 page ‘NLP + Speech cheat sheet’ with operations, inputs/outputs, and gotchas.","Quick self-test: answer 15 of your own flashcards without notes; fix weak areas.","Checklist update."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) NLP+Speech cheat sheet, (2) decision tree for text analytics, (3) 10 samples mapped to operations + 5 scenarios."},{"weekNumber":7,"objective":"Knowledge mining & information extraction: Azure AI Search deeper concepts, Document Intelligence, and Content Understanding pipelines; tie back into RAG/agents.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Study knowledge mining objectives: skillsets/custom skills, indexers, Knowledge Store projections, semantic + vector store solutions (revisit your Week 3 notes).","Refresh Azure AI Search basics from the training page references: https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training","Write a mini-architecture: documents (PDF/images) → OCR/enrichment → index → semantic/vector query."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Document Intelligence objectives: prebuilt models vs custom models, train/test/publish, composed models.","Create a comparison table: prebuilt vs custom vs composed (when to use, effort, data requirements).","Draft a ‘form processing’ workflow including validation and confidence thresholds."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Content Understanding objectives: OCR pipeline, summarize/classify/detect attributes, extract entities/tables/images, process/ingest multi-modal content.","Write how this differs from simple OCR + LLM prompting (where structured extraction fits).","Add 5 scenarios: invoice extraction, contract clause extraction, table extraction, classification, multi-modal ingestion."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Integration day: design one end-to-end solution combining Document Intelligence/Content Understanding + Search + GenAI (RAG) + (optional) agent.","Write what you would monitor (latency, cost, errors) and what security controls apply (keys/auth, PII).","Checklist update + prepare final practice week."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) comparison table for Document Intelligence approaches, (2) end-to-end architecture diagram tying extraction→search→RAG/agent, (3) 5 scenarios with chosen services and rationale."},{"weekNumber":8,"objective":"Final consolidation: full-domain review, targeted remediation, and final practice assessment readiness.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Do a full checklist pass: any Red items become today’s focus; rewrite the concept in your own words.","Re-skim the AI-102 skills measured headings to ensure nothing is missing: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","Create a one-page ‘last day before exam’ sheet (service selection + key constraints + monitoring/responsible AI)."]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Take the AI-102 practice assessment again (timed). Record score and weak objectives: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/practice/assessment?assessment-type=practice&assessmentId=61","For each missed question area, link it back to a specific study guide bullet and add a corrective note.","Identify the top 3 remaining weak domains."]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Targeted remediation on top 3 weak domains (use your notes + course outline page as a guide): https://learn.microsoft.com/training/courses/ai-102t00","Do a scenario drill: write 12 mini case-studies (2 per domain) and answer: service choice, steps, security, monitoring, responsible AI.","Review your scenario answers and correct them against the skills outline."]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":90,"tasks":["Light review + exam mechanics: read the ‘prepare for an exam’ practice assessment guidance (focus on how to use results effectively): https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/prepare-exam#take-a-practice-assessment","Finalize flashcards (aim for ~40–60 total) and do a final pass.","Stop-study plan: decide what you’ll review the day before the exam (only the 1-page sheet + flashcards)."]}],"checkpoint":"Deliverables: (1) updated final checklist all Green/mostly Green, (2) final practice assessment results + remediation notes, (3) 1-page last-day sheet + 12 scenario drill answers."}],"briefMessageToUser":"Follow four 90-minute sessions per week, keep everything tied to the AI-102 study guide checklist, and use the two practice-assessment checkpoints (Week 4 and Week 8) to drive what you review next—this is the fastest way to turn limited hours into exam-ready coverage."}

Produce JSON only matching the provided schema

{"rationale":"This engagement plan follows the student’s 8-week AI-102 schedule with four 90-minute sessions per week, reinforcing the official Microsoft Learn resources already embedded in the plan (exam page, study guide, course, modules, Azure AI Search training, agents tool limitations, practice assessments, and exam prep guidance). Reminders are timed at consistent evening study slots to build habit, include direct links to the exact referenced material for each session, and add extra mid-week motivation notes to sustain momentum and close gaps revealed by the Week 4 and Week 8 practice assessments.","recipientEmail":"student@example.com","reminders":[{"schedule":"2026-02-24T18:30:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 1 (90 min): Lock in AI-102 scope + checklist","body":"Start by reading the AI-102 certification + exam pages, then skim the official study guide and turn the Skills Measured into a checklist you’ll track weekly. Keep notes on what looks unfamiliar so you can target it during sessions 2–4.

Certification: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/azure-ai-engineer/
Exam: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/
Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-02-25T18:30:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 2 (90 min): Course map + Planning module","body":"Open the AI-102 course outline, then complete the planning module and finish the knowledge check—capture every miss as a Yellow/Red checklist item. This sets the foundation for every hands-on build later.

Course: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/courses/ai-102t00
Module: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/prepare-azure-ai-development/","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/prepare-azure-ai-development/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-26T18:30:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 3 (90 min): Service selection map (Plan/Manage)","body":"Use the AI-102 study guide Skills Measured to draft your 1-page service selection map (GenAI/Vision/Language/Speech/Search/Doc extraction). Aim for clarity over length—this becomes your go-to exam decision tool.

Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-02-27T18:30:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 4 (90 min): Responsible AI notes + weekly self-quiz","body":"Review Responsible AI topics in the AI-102 study guide and add exam-ready controls (safety filters, prompt shields, governance) to your Exam Notes doc. End with a 15-minute checklist self-quiz and mark Green/Yellow/Red.

Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-03-03T18:30:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 1 (90 min): Generative AI objectives + deployment steps","body":"Use the study guide’s Generative AI section to outline what you must be able to do (deploy, prompt flow, RAG, eval/monitoring). Keep it exam-focused: verbs + what you’d configure/validate.

Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-03-04T18:30:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 2 (90 min): RAG overview module (grounding + indexing)","body":"Complete the RAG overview module and write a clean pipeline diagram (ingest → chunk → embed → index → retrieve → prompt → generate). Pay special attention to where citations come from and what ‘grounded’ means.

Module: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-05T18:30:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 3 (90 min): Minimal chat caller + parameter experiments","body":"Implement your minimal chat caller and run quick parameter experiments (temperature/max tokens) while logging request id + latency placeholders. You’re building muscle memory for “what to tweak and why” questions.

Course (reference for structure/topics): https://learn.microsoft.com/training/courses/ai-102t00","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/courses/ai-102t00"},{"schedule":"2026-03-06T18:30:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 4 (90 min): RAG tuning flashcards + weekly review","body":"Define chunking + retrieval knobs (topK, filters, semantic vs vector, citations) and turn them into flashcards you can recall fast. Finish by updating your checklist and picking 3 items to revisit next week.

RAG module (for reinforcement): https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-10T18:30:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 1 (90 min): Azure AI Search learning path selection + schema essentials","body":"Use the Azure AI Search training landing page to choose what to read next, then write down index schema essentials (key + searchable/filterable/facetable/sortable fields). This directly powers the knowledge mining exam domain.

Azure AI Search training: https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training"},{"schedule":"2026-03-11T18:30:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 2 (90 min): RAG integration recap + toy dataset plan","body":"Revisit the RAG module with a Search lens and draft your step checklist (create index → load docs → embeddings optional → query → pass results into prompt). Keep it as a build recipe you can explain end-to-end.

Module: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/build-copilot-ai-studio/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-12T18:30:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 3 (90 min): Query practice + agent/Search constraints note","body":"Draft example queries (filter/sort/semantic vs vector intent) and write what good grounding/citations should look like. Then capture the key agent + AI Search limitations so you don’t design impossible solutions on the exam.

AI Search tool limitations (agents): https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-foundry/agents/how-to/tools/ai-search?view=foundry#limitations","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-foundry/agents/how-to/tools/ai-search?view=foundry#limitations"},{"schedule":"2026-03-13T18:30:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 4 (90 min): 1-page Search-for-RAG summary + weekly checklist update","body":"Write your 1-page “Azure AI Search for RAG” summary (components + pitfalls) and create 10 self Q&As (indexers vs push API, skillsets enrichment, etc.). Close with a checklist update to tee up Week 4 agent focus.

Azure AI Search training: https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training"},{"schedule":"2026-03-17T18:30:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 1 (90 min): Agentic objectives + module overview","body":"Complete the agent module overview and write a short rule: when to use an agent vs a single prompt/chain. Tie your notes to the AI-102 ‘create/test/optimize/deploy’ verbs.

Module: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-18T18:30:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 2 (90 min): Agent exercise + evaluation criteria","body":"Do the agent module exercise (or simulate it carefully) and document your agent contract: inputs, tools, formatting, and safety constraints. Add evaluation criteria (success rate, hallucinations, grounded citations, latency) so you can justify design choices.

Module: https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/develop-ai-agent-azure/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-19T18:30:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 3 (90 min): Agent + retrieval workflow designs","body":"Outline how an agent would call Azure AI Search and cite results, then write 3 multi-step workflows with explicit tool calls. Finish with a testing matrix (happy path, missing data, ambiguity, unsafe prompt).

AI Search tool limitations (agents): https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-foundry/agents/how-to/tools/ai-search?view=foundry#limitations","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/ai-foundry/agents/how-to/tools/ai-search?view=foundry#limitations"},{"schedule":"2026-03-20T18:30:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 4 (90 min): Midpoint practice assessment + gap list","body":"Take the official AI-102 practice assessment timed, then immediately tag weak areas as Red/Yellow in your checklist and write your top-5 remediation list for Weeks 5–7. Your score matters less than the gap list you produce.

Practice assessment: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/practice/assessment?assessment-type=practice&assessmentId=61","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/exams/ai-102/practice/assessment?assessment-type=practice&assessmentId=61"},{"schedule":"2026-03-24T18:30:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 1 (90 min): Vision objectives + request/response template","body":"Use the Vision section in the AI-102 study guide to build a request/response template (what you send, what you get back, how to interpret it). Then do a quick drill: pick 5 images and decide the right features for each scenario.

Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-03-25T18:30:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 2 (90 min): OCR + Custom Vision concepts and flashcards","body":"Outline OCR steps (printed vs handwritten) and capture common output fields + error handling, then decide classification vs object detection for 3 scenarios and make flashcards for metrics and lifecycle. Focus on mapping “requirement → approach” quickly.

Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-03-26T18:30:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 3 (90 min): Video Indexer + spatial analysis + scenarios","body":"Summarize what Azure AI Video Indexer provides and write down spatial analysis privacy considerations you must remember. Close with 5 exam-style scenarios mapping requirement → service/feature choice.

Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-03-27T18:30:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 4 (90 min): Vision cheat sheet + weekly checklist update","body":"Consolidate everything into a 2-page Vision cheat sheet and revisit any practice-assessment Reds/Yellows related to vision. End by updating your checklist—this is how you turn study time into guaranteed coverage.

Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-03-31T18:30:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 1 (90 min): NLP + Speech objectives + decision tree","body":"Use the AI-102 study guide to build a text analytics decision tree (requirement → operation) and classify 10 sample texts by which operation you’d run and why. Keep answers in exam language: inputs, outputs, and constraints.

Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-04-01T18:30:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 2 (90 min): Translation + PII secure handling scenarios","body":"Outline translation options and write your PII secure-handling checklist (masking, storage, logging rules). Then do 5 exam-style scenarios mapping requirement → service/feature with 1–2 lines of justification.

Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-04-02T18:30:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 3 (90 min): Speech pipelines + SSML + customization notes","body":"Write the STT and TTS pipelines and add SSML enhancements you can explain (prosody/pronunciation). Capture when custom speech is worth it and add privacy/consent/retention notes for speech solutions.

Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-04-03T18:30:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 4 (90 min): NLP+Speech cheat sheet + self-test","body":"Create your 1–2 page NLP+Speech cheat sheet, then self-test 15 flashcards without notes and patch the weak spots immediately. Close by updating the checklist so Week 7 can focus on knowledge mining and extraction.

Study guide: https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-102"},{"schedule":"2026-04-07T18:30:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 1 (90 min): Knowledge mining deep dive (Search skillsets/indexers)","body":"Revisit Azure AI Search training and draft a mini-architecture from documents → OCR/enrichment → index → semantic/vector query. Focus on skillsets, indexers, and Knowledge Store concepts you can describe in a scenario.

Azure AI Search training: https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/search/resource-training"},{"schedule":"2026-04-08T18:30:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 2 (90 min): Document Intelligence approach table + workflow","body":"Build your comparison table (prebuilt vs custom vs composed) and draft a form-processing workflow with validation + confidence thresholds. Keep it decision-focused: why you’d choose each approach.
